entries.name: Age
entries: Tanarukk reach adulthood at age 12 but live a few years longer than humans do.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Tanarukk respect strength above all else and believe the strong must bully the weak to ensure that weakness does not spread like a disease. They are usually chaotic evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: Tanarukk can grow up to 8 feet tall and typically weigh between 240 and 400 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Tanarukk combine fiendish toughness with orc endurance. Their skin grows dense and hard. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

entries.name: Hellfire Strike
entries: You can tap into your inner fire and channel it to power your attacks. When you hit with a melee weapon attack, you can choose to add 1d6 fire damage to the damage rolled.
You can use this feature a number of time equal to your Consitution modifier (minimum of 1), and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
At 6th level the damage increases to 2d6, then to 3d6 at 11th level, and to 4d6 at 16th level.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Orc and Abyssal.

entries.name: Racial Variant: Infernal Tanarukk
entries: Some Tanarukk are born with a higher concentration of fiendish blood, warping their biology closer to that of the hellish terrors they come from.
To represent this, their Natural Armor trait is replaced with the following:

entries.name: Devilish Resistance
entries: You are resistant to fire and poison damage.
Tanarukk are Orcs with a mixture of fiendish blood, and are born when Orcs turn to Baphomet as their deity, usually in a time of need.
Their figure is about the same as an Orc, but with bull-like horns protruding from their head and bony spikes that grow from their shoulders, neck and back.
Tanarukk also had the distinctive smell of brimstone about them and are capable of some natural pyromancy which they use to imbue their attacks with fire.
Some Tanarukk live among Orcs, but not every clan welcomes them. Some tribes see themselves as harmed by fiends and decide to hunt Tanarukk in revenge.

They are nasty, brutish, and not terribly intelligent (despite being smarter than an average orc); they are, however, extremely dangerous fighters. In spite of their lack of personal magnetism, Tanarukks' instinctive ability to control flame leads many to become sorcerers.
